overview: Vast, wild, and remote, the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge is where some of the worldâ€™s greatest wildlife spectacles unfold. Situated in northeastern Alaska, this Refuge has long protected survivors of the Ice Age that still roam a frozen wilderness. Now, this icy fortress is melting due to climate change. For the caribou, musk oxen, polar bears, and Arctic foxes, the Ice Age is slipping away.
title: Nature: American Arctic
